profileText: A Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Sherburne, Chenango County, N.Y., July 13, 1818; taught school; studied law; was admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Tunkhannock, Wyoming County, Pa., about 1843; elected as a Democrat to the Thirty-first Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Chester Butler (January 13, 1851-March 3, 1851); president of the Delaware, Lackawanna & Western Railway Co., 1863-1867 and member of the board of managers and general counsel from 1867 until his death in Newark, N.J., February 3, 1880; interment in Evergreen Cemetery, Elizabeth, N.J.

note.content: Elected to fill vacancy caused by death of Chester P. Butler, and took his seat January 13, 1851.

researchRecord.name: In the Delaware, Lackawanna and Western Railroad Company Records, 1828-1960, 2010 linear feet and 12 reels of microfilm.
researchRecord.description: Included are three groups of records from the Delaware, Lackawanna and Western Railroad Company. The records include letter books of John Brisbin, who was the Counsel and General Land Agent for the company and cover the ongoing purchases of coal lands. The records also cover the period when John Brisbin served as president of the Delaware, Lackawanna and Western Railroad Company. Unpublished guides are available to the groups of records.
